title: Claude Opus 4.1 Reaches General Availability with 74.5% SWE-bench Accuracy
content:
Anthropic has announced the general availability of Claude Opus 4.1, marking a significant milestone in AI coding assistance. The model, which has been in limited release, now achieves an industry-leading 74.5% accuracy on the SWE-bench software engineering benchmark, surpassing both its predecessor and competing models.

Claude Opus 4.1 represents the world's best coding model with sustained performance on complex, long-running tasks and agent workflows. The model excels particularly in Terminal-bench testing at 43.2%, demonstrating superior capabilities in real-world coding scenarios.

Key improvements include enhanced context understanding with support for up to 1 million tokens, allowing developers to work with entire codebases in a single session. The model also features improved precision in code generation, reducing the need for manual corrections and debugging.

Anthropic has integrated Claude Opus 4.1 across all platforms including Claude Pro, Max, Team, and Enterprise subscriptions, as well as through the Anthropic API, Amazon Bedrock, and Google Cloud's Vertex AI. Pricing remains consistent at $15/$75 per million tokens for input/output respectively.

The release comes alongside Claude Code's general availability, which now includes background tasks via GitHub Actions and native integrations with VS Code and JetBrains IDEs, enabling seamless pair programming experiences.
summary: Claude Opus 4.1 reaches general availability with 74.5% SWE-bench accuracy and 1M token context window, establishing itself as the leading AI coding model across all major platforms.
author: Anthropic Team
